p: The most widely used and known nanoparticles are those of precious metals: Gold and silver. They undergo various processes which are not observed in macroscopic environments. Nanosilver has antimicrobial (antifungal and antibacterial) properties. Gold in its nanoform offers therapeutic effects due to its ease to penetrate body cells where it strongly stimulates their regeneration [ 3, 4]. Nanoparticles of precious metals form stable colloidal solutions, which can be applied to plant in vitro cultures [ 5].
